intro: Cheilocostus borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo ginger, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other well-known gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and ornamental, fragrant leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in inflorescences, often with a distinctive reddish hue. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
